name: Piotr Indyk
content: Piotr Indyk Piotr Indyk I am a Thomas D. and Virginia W. Cabot Professor in the Department of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science. I am a co-director of Foundations of Data Science Institute (FODSI). I am also a member of Theory of Computation Group in Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Lab, Wireless@MIT, Big Data@CSAIL and Mifods. Short bio (on wiki). Code: FALCONN - fast algorithm for similarity search, based on Locality Sensitive Hashing. The project web page on our Sparse FFT algorithms, with the code for sFFT 1.0 and 2.0 algorithms published in SODA'12. Research Interests: High-dimensional computational geometry (including approximate nearest neighbor search), data stream algorithms, sparse recovery, compressive sensing, machine learning algorithms, learning-based algorithms.
